509150108  reserved article v  fertilizer short title this article shall be known and may be cited as the city of melbourne fertilizer  2762 3262013 purpose and intent this article regulates and promotes the proper use of fertilizers by any applicator  requires proper training of commercial and institutional fertilizer applicators  establishes training and licensing requirements  establishes a prohibited application period  specifies allowable fertilizer application rates and methods  fertilizerfree zones  low maintenance zones  and exemptions the article requires the use of best management practices which provide specific management guidelines to minimize negative secondary and cumulative environmental effects associated with the misuse of fertilizers these secondary and cumulative effects have been observed in and on city natural and constructed stormwater conveyances and surface waters collectively these water bodies are an asset critical to the environmental recreational cultural and economic wellbeing of the city and county residents and the health of the public overgrowth of algae and vegetation hinder the effectiveness of flood attenuation provided by natural and constructed stormwater conveyances regulation of nutrients including both phosphorus and nitrogen contained in fertilizer will help improve and maintain water and habitat quality 2763 3262013 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning administrator means the city manager or designee authorized to administer and enforce the provisions of this article application or apply means the actual physical deposit of fertilizer to turf specialized turf or landscape plants applicator means any person who applies fertilizer on turf andor landscape plants in the city best management practices means turf and landscape practices or combination of practices based on research fieldtesting and expert review determined to be the most effective and practicable onlocation means including economic and technological considerations for improving water quality conserving water supplies and protecting natural resources officer official or inspector means any designated employee or agent of the city whose duty it is to enforce codes and ordinances enacted by the city commercial fertilizer applicator  except as provided in fs  9 means any person who applies fertilizer for payment or other consideration to property not owned by the person or firm applying the fertilizer or the employer of the applicator countyapproved best management practices training program means a training program approved pursuant to fs   or any more stringent requirements set forth in this article that includes the most current version of the florida department of environmental protections floridafriendly best management practices for protection of water resources by the green industries 200 as revised and approved by the administrator fertilize fertilizing or fertilization means the act of applying fertilizer to turf specialized turf or landscape plants fertilizer means any substance or mixture of substances that contains one or more recognized plant nutrients and promotes plant growth or controls soil acidity or alkalinity or provides other soil enrichment or provides other corrective measures to the soil fertilizer free zone means an area within 15 feet of any surface waters pond stream watercourse lake canal or wetland where fertilizer shall not be applied guaranteed analysis means the percentage of plant nutrients or measures of neutralizing capability claimed to be present in a fertilizer institutional applicator means any person other than a private noncommercial or a commercial applicator unless such definitions also apply under the circumstances that applies fertilizer for the purpose of maintaining turf andor landscape plants institutional applicators shall include but shall not be limited to owners managers or employees of public lands schools parks religious institutions utilities industrial or business sites and any residential properties maintained in condominium andor common ownership landscape plant means any native or exotic tree shrub or groundcover excluding turf low maintenance zone means an area a minimum of 25 feet wide adjacent to surface waters which is planted and managed in order to minimize the need for fertilization watering mowing etc person means any natural person business corporation limited liability company partnership limited partnership association club organization andor any group of people acting as an organized entity prohibited application period means the time period during which a flood watch or warning or a tropical storm watch or warning or a hurricane watch or warning is in effect for any portion of the county issued by the national weather service or if heavy rain is likely restricted application period means the time period beginning june 1 and ending september 30 of each calendar year saturated soil means a soil in which the voids are filled with water saturation does not require flow for the purposes of this article soils shall be considered saturated if standing water is present or the pressure of a person standing on the soil causes the release of free water slow release controlled release timed release slowly available or water insoluble nitrogen means nitrogen in a form which delays its availability for plant uptake and use after application or which extends its availability to the plant longer than a reference rapid or quick release product surface waters as defined by the florida department of environmental protection fac ch 62340 means waters on the surface of the earth contained in bounds created naturally or artificially including the atlantic ocean bays bayous sounds estuaries lagoons lakes ponds impoundments rivers streams springs creeks branches sloughs tributaries canals and ditches turf sod or lawn means a piece of grasscovered soil held together by the roots of the grass urban landscape means pervious areas on residential commercial industrial institutional highway rightsofway or other nonagricultural lands that are planted with turf or horticultural plants for the purposes of this section the term agriculture has the same meaning as in fs  57002 2764 3262013  2764 9112014 applicability this article shall be applicable to and shall regulate any and all applicators of fertilizer and areas of application of fertilizer within the city unless such applicator is specifically exempted by the terms of this article from the regulatory provisions of this article this article shall be prospective only and shall not impair any existing contracts 2765 3262013 timing of fertilizer application no applicator shall apply fertilizers containing nitrogen andor phosphorus to turf andor landscape plants during the prohibited application period or to saturated soils in addition no fertilizer containing nitrogen or phosphorus shall be applied to turf or landscape plants during the restricted application period 2766 3262013  2766 9112014 fertilizer free zone fertilizer shall not be applied within 15 feet of any surface waters pond stream watercourse lake canal or wetland as defined by the florida department of environmental protection fac ch 62340 or within 15 feet from the top of a seawall newly planted turf andor landscape plants may be fertilized in this zone for a 60day period beginning 30 days after planting if needed to allow the plants to become well established caution shall be used to prevent direct deposition of nutrients into the water the requirements of section 50113 also apply to newly planted turf and landscape plants in this zone no mowed or cut vegetative material should be deposited or left remaining in this zone or deposited in the water care should be taken to prevent the overspray of aquatic weed products in this zone the fertilizer free zone must be vegetated or have some form of erosion protection to prevent sediment and fertilizer from entering the water body 2767 3262013  2767 9112014 low maintenance zone a voluntary 25foot low maintenance zone is strongly recommended but not mandated from any surface waters pond stream watercourse lake wetland or from the top of a seawall a swaleberm system is recommended for installation at the landward edge of this low maintenance zone to capture and filter runoff no mowed or cut vegetative material should be deposited or left remaining in this zone or deposited in the water care should be taken to prevent the overspray of aquatic weed products in this zone the low maintenance zone area must be vegetated or have some form of erosion protection to prevent sediment and fertilizer from entering the water body 2768 3262013  2768 9112014 fertilizer content and application rates a only no phosphate fertilizer as defined in rule 5e florida administrative may be applied to turf or landscape plants in the city without a soil or plant tissue deficiency as verified by a university of florida institute of food and agriculture sciences approved testing methodology in the case that a deficiency has been verified the application of a fertilizer containing phosphorous shall be in accordance with the rates and directions provided by rule 5e florida administrative verification shall be no more than two years old however recent application of compost manure or top soil shall warrant more recent testing to verify current deficiencies b the nitrogen content of fertilizer applied to turf or landscape plants within the city shall contain slow release  controlled release timed release slowly available or water insoluble nitrogen per guaranteed analysis label of not less than 50 percent caution shall be used to prevent direct deposition of nutrients in the water c unless otherwise stipulated herein fertilizers applied to turf within the city shall be applied at rates that are in accordance with requirements and directions provided by rule 5e florida department of agriculture and consumer services urban turf rule labeling requirements for urban turf fertilizers d fertilizer containing nitrogen or phosphorus shall not be applied before seeding or sodding a site and shall not be applied for the first 30 days after seeding or sodding except when hydroseeding for temporary or permanent erosion control in an emergency situation wildfire etc or in accordance with the stormwater pollution prevention plan for that site e where golf courses parks and athletic fields are subject to and implementing best management practices as prescribed in rule 5e10032d florida administrative they shall be exempt from this section 2769 3262013  2769 9112014 application practices a spreader deflector shields are required when fertilizing via rotary broadcast spreaders deflectors must be positioned such that fertilizer granules are deflected away from all impervious surfaces fertilizerfree zones surface waters and water bodies including wetlands b fertilizer shall not be applied spilled or otherwise deposited on any impervious surfaces c any fertilizer applied spilled or deposited either intentionally or accidentally on any impervious surface shall be immediately and completely removed to the greatest extent practicable and either legally applied to turf or any other legal site or returned to the original or other appropriate container d in no case shall fertilizer be washed swept or blown off impervious surfaces into stormwater drains ditches conveyances or water bodies 2770 3262013 management of grass clippings and vegetative matter in no case shall grass clippings vegetative material andor vegetative debris be washed swept or blown off into surface waters stormwater drains ditches conveyances watercourses water bodies wetlands sidewalks or roadways any material that is accidentally so deposited shall be immediately removed to the maximum extent practicable 2771 3262013 exemptions the provisions set forth in this article shall not apply to 1 bona fide farm operations as defined in the florida right to farm act fs  82314 2 any lands used for scientific research supported by an accredited institution of higher learning railroads operating trains in and city shall maintain street crossings wherever the tracks of the railroad cross any street the railroad company shall cause that portion of such intersection occupied by its tracks to be paved in such a manner as will ensure a smooth crossing both for vehicles and pedestrians the paving used shall consist of concrete asphalt or wood or a combination thereof and shall be kept in good repair at all times the railroad shall erect crossarm signs commonly used by railroad companies to denote such crossings in case of failure to comply with this section in street facility or park name changes  application fee a application by city a proposal to change the name of any private or public street or any public facility or park within the city may be initiated by a vote of the city council such vote shall constitute direction to the city manager and city attorney to prepare either an ordinance for a street renaming or a resolution for a public facility or park renaming said ordinance or resolution shall be classified as an application as that term is used herein applications initiated by the city council shall be exempt from the requirements of subsections b c d e and f1 of this section b application by general public real property owner or other governmental agency every applicant seeking to change the name of any public or private street or any public facility or park other than the city including but not limited to an owner of real property within the city a governmental entity other than the city or other person shall be required to file an application pursuant to the requirements of subsection c of this section and to satisfy the requirements of subsections d e and f of this section c application form a complete application for a change of the name of a street or any public facility or park within the city shall be submitted to the city manager along with the consent to change street name form provided for in subsection d of this section and an application fee of $20000 all costs including notices mailings sign changes and associated costs shall be the responsibility of the applicant when the city determines the costs to be greater than $20000 an estimate will be provided to the applicant and payment for the difference shall be submitted for the application to be considered complete any unutilized funds will be returned to the applicant d consent by adjacent property owners required for street name changes 1 for the purposes of this section a property owner is defined as any individual corporation partnership or other legal entity who owns in fee simple or holds a leasehold interest with a remaining term of 30 years or more in real property 2 at least 70 percent by front footage of the property owners who own real property any portion of which abuts the rightofwaystreet segment which is subject to the application for name change must execute a consent to change street name form which form shall be attached to the application a person who has executed a consent form may at any time up until final passage of the ordinance request in writing that his signature be deleted from the consent form a in determining if at least 70 percent of the property owners who own real property abutting the rightofwaystreet segment which is subject to the application for name change have executed the consent form the city shall ascertain the total number of front feet of real property abutting both sides of the rightofwaystreet segment subject to the application this number shall form a denominator of a fraction the numerator shall be the total number of front feet abutting the rightofwaystreet segment owned by persons executing the consent form if the fraction is not greater than 70 percent then the application shall be deemed to be insufficient for further review and consideration in computing the overall number of front feet of property which abuts the rightofwaystreet segment subject to an application to change street name 1 public streets and roadways owned by a governmental entity or property owned by the city shall not be considered  and 2 private property which is contiguous at a point shall not be counted b in determining whether a person executing a consent form is in fact a fee simple owner of real property able to consent to a street name change as provided herein the city may use the latest ad valorem tax rolls prepared by the county at the time of receipt of the application or more current evidence of ownership in the form of a deed submitted to the city no consent shall be valid if it is executed more than 120 days prior to the date of submission of the application to change street name or if any of the information in subsection d3 of this section is not completed 3 the consent to change street name form shall be in a format provided by the city manager e amendments by an applicant petitioning for change of name of city street facility or park after the application has been filed amendments are not permitted without the approval of the city council or as otherwise permitted in this section f criteria for renaming a street facility or park 1 the following criteria shall be used by the city manager or designee to determine whether the city street facility or park is eligible for renaming a the change of name of a city street shall not prove disruptive or adverse to the ability of emergency services including police fire paramedic ambulance services and the countys emergency 911 system to respond to an emergency involving the life safety or health of any person b if the request is to change the name of a private street or a public street operated and maintained by other than the city the city shall attempt to obtain consent to the name change from the owneroperator of the street c required consent from abutting property owners for a street name change as required in subsection d has been met d the renaming of a street facility or park name that has been in existence for 30 years or more will not be considered unless there is a compelling public safety reason e streets facilities or parks that have already been renamed are not eligible for renaming again f duplicate street names will not be considered g proliferation of the same name for different city streets facilities or parks shall be avoided h names that promote alcohol and tobacco products or political organizations shall not be considered i names with connotations which by contemporary community standards are derogatory or offensive shall not be considered 2 the following additional guidelines shall be used by the city manager or designee to evaluate the request for renaming a city street facility or park a the cost that the renaming will have on any other person that is or could be materially affected by the name change b use of recognized geographic names c use of natural historic features d cultural or historical significance to the city or surrounding neighborhood e preference to names of long established local usage and names that lend dignity to the street facility or park f when naming for a person 1 a biography and other relevant background information must be included 2 the person must have achieved prominence as a result of his or her significant positive contribution to the united states state andor to the local community 3 the person must have been deceased for at least five years 4 the person must not have been convicted of any felony or crime involving moral turpitude or had pending charges at the time of his or her death 5 if renaming for a living person the person must have made significant contributions to the community for a period of greater than 25 years 6 the person may not be a current city council member or city employee 7 the person may have made a significant financial contribution to the city or to a specific facility or park 3 following a determination that the application is sufficient for consideration or a vote by the city council to initiate consideration as set forth in subsection a of this section the city manager or designee shall review the application taking into consideration the preceding criteria and shall make a recommendation to the city council regarding the proposed change of name g city council consideration 1 upon receipt of a sufficient and completed application as set forth above or after a vote of the city council pursuant to subsection a of this section as the case may be and the receipt by the city council of the recommendation of the city manager the city council shall hold a public hearing regarding the name change 2 courtesy notice a a courtesy notice shall be prepared and mailed by the city to the property owners of record of any parcel of real property any portion of which abuts as described in subsection d of this section the rightofwaystreet segment subject to consideration to have its name changed courtesy notices will also be mailed to property owners of record within 500 feet of a facility or park that is being considered for renaming failure to mail the courtesy notice failure to include all information in correct form or substance as required herein or failure of the intended recipient to receive the notice shall not affect any proceeding or action taken with regard to an ordinance to change the name of any segment of any street the property owners to whom the courtesy notice may be mailed shall be those property owners listed on the latest ad valorem tax rolls prepared by the county at the time of mailing of the courtesy notice mailing shall be by first class united states mail postage prepaid notice shall be deemed to have been given when the courtesy notice is deposited in the united states mail b the courtesy notice shall state that a proposal has been made to change the name of a segment of a city street facility or park identify the existing and proposed name of the street facility or park  the date when the change would go into effect  and the end points of the street segment affected the notice shall also state the time date and place of the proposed public hearing by the city council the courtesy notice shall be mailed at least ten days prior to the second reading of an ordinance to accomplish a name change of the 7262016   2282017 secs 5285232  reserved _____ article ii  numbering of buildings and property system established  incorporation of map a uniform system of numbering properties and principal buildings as shown on the map identified by the title property numbering grid map which is filed in the office of the city engineer is hereby adopted for use in the city this map and all explanatory matter thereon is hereby adopted and made a part of this article      5282002 administration a the city engineer shall be responsible for maintaining the numbering system adopted by this article b the city engineer shall duly record all numbers assigned under section 5233 c the city engineer shall assign to any property owner in the city or its immediate environs upon request and without charge a property number for each principal building or separate front entrance to such building however the city engineer may issue additional property numbers in accordance with the official numbering system whenever a property has been subdivided a new front entrance opened or undue hardship has been worked on any property owner    assignment of numbers a all properties or parcels of land within the city shall be identified by reference to the uniform numbering system adopted in this article b each principal building shall have its own unique address number address numbers shall be assigned in accordance with the numbering system adopted in this article c address numbers shall be consistent with all even number on the west and north side of each street and all odd numbers on the south and east side of each street babcock street shall be the boundary line for east and west and brevard drive shall be the boundary line for north and south oddeven numbers shall not be changed when the street direction curves or changes d corner lot address numbers shall be assigned on the street where the structure faces if accessible to that street e street names should not contain a directional reference north south east and west unless they cross the boundary line or change zip code      5282002 numbering multiplefamily structures each principal building shall bear the number assigned to the frontage on which the front entrance is located a principal building with four or more units shall be assigned one property address number and shall have unique unit numbers for each unit unit numbers not letters should increase consistently with the address grid for example multiple story buildings should have unit numbers of 100199 on the first habitable floor 200299 on the second habitable floor etc      5282002 numerals to be posted  dimensions  coloration a numerals indicating the official numbers for each principal building or each front entrance to such building shall be posted in a manner as to be clearly visible and distinguishable from the street on which the property is located such numerals shall be a minimum of six inches in height on commercial buildings and a minimum of three inches in height on all other buildings at least onehalf inch in width and of a contrasting color with the building b if the building is not clearly visible andor the number not legible from the public or private way an additional building number must be placed in a manner easily visible from a public or private way      8271985   5282002 secs 52385264  reserved article iii  crossing sidewalk or curb where no driveway exists permit required no person shall operate any vehicle of any kind or character on or over any sidewalk or curb within the city except at such places as driveways exist without first obtaining a permit from the building official and a rightofway use permit from the city engineer      5282002 application for permit in case any person desires to operate any vehicle on or over any sidewalk or curb at any place except at a driveway he shall make application to the building official therefor the application shall specify the place involved the duration of time for which such permit is desired and the kind of vehicles desired to be operated on or over the place specified      5282002 term of permit permits issued pursuant to section 5265 shall not be valid for a period of longer than 60 days    secs 52685292  reserved article iv  abandonment of public rightsofway and easements power to open straighten divert widen narrow or vacate public ways the city council may upon its own motion or upon the request of any agency of the state or of the federal government or upon the written petition of any person owning property abutting any public street or alley located within the city limits or within the territory lying within the jurisdiction of the city cause any street alley or public highway to be opened straightened diverted widened narrowed or vacated ch 28 art vintro   9112007 purposes and methods the purpose of this article is to establish a uniform procedure for applications to the city for the vacation and abandonment of city streets alleys special purpose easements and other nonfee interests of the city  to provide a method for the city to vacate and abandon its fee interest in the public rightofway  to designate the appropriate departments of the city that shall be responsible for the processing of such applications  and to provide procedures and standards that shall govern such processing the process and act of vacating abandoning or terminating the citys and publics rights in a rightofway or platted easement is quasijudicial in nature this article relates solely to the vacating abandonment and termination of the citys and publics rights in a rightofway or easement which has been dedicated usually act of platting    9112007 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning abandon or vacate means to renounce or disclaim all interest of the city and of the public in and to any land dedicated for transportation or travel by the public or to an easement dedicated for public use abutting property means and refers to any parcel of real property whose boundary or any part thereof also serves as the boundary or any part thereof of the petition site affected property means and refers to any parcel of real property or portion thereof which lies within 500 feet of the boundaries of the petition site city or public rightofway means and refers to any rightofway acquired by the city or the public by virtue of dedication to the public or the city on a plat by separate instrument of conveyance by eminent domain or by prescription easement means and refers to any strip of land or body of water created by an owner or subdivider for public or private travel access utilities drainage sanitation or other specified uses having limitations the fee title to which shall remain in the name of the property owner subject to the right of use designated in the document granting the easement lead review department means and refers to the department within the city that is designated by the city manager as having the responsibility to administer the petition for abandonment owner means and refers to the person governmental entity or other entity that is the fee simple title holder of real property as shown on the current tax rolls of the county property appraiser unless the city has actual knowledge that a person or entity other than the person or entity shown on the tax roll is the actual owner petition for abandonment or petition means and refers to the form prescribed by the lead review department which requests the abandonment of a rightofway or public easement pursuant to this article petition site means and refers to the portion of a rightofway or easement that is the subject of a petition for abandonment or a petition for release of interest or a petition for vacation pursuant to this article petitioner means and refers to the person governmental entity or other entity submitting a petition for vacation pursuant to this article plat means any drawing of real property made and recorded pursuant to fs ch 177 private easement or interest dedicated by separate instrument means and refers to any road street alleyway utility drainage pedestrian air light access ingress or egress flowage or similar easement or interest that is dedicated by separate instrument to any person or entity other than the federal government the state government or any of its subdivisions or agencies pursuant to requirements of the city private rightofway means and refers to any rightofway dedicated or deeded to an owners association or the owner of the abutting property or which is dedicated as a rightofway and is the perpetual maintenance obligation of any owners association or the owner of abutting property public easement means and refers to any utility maintenance or drainage easement that is dedicated by plat in perpetuity for utility or drainage purposes or which is conveyed by a separate instrument approved by the city the term public easement shall not include instruments of conveyances or dedications made to specifically named utility companies owners associations or other governmental entities reviewing department means and refers to the departments within the city that shall participate in the review of the petition for abandonment rightofway means and refers to land dedicated deeded used or to be used for a boulevard road street alley walkway drainage facility access for ingress and egress or other purposes by the public certain designated individuals or governing bodies the term rightofway shall apply to city rightsofway whether dedicated by plat or separate instrument    9112007 filing fee every application or petition filed with the city for the vacating or narrowing of a rightofway or an easement shall be in writing and shall be accompanied by a filing fee as set out in section 2507 such fee shall be used for the costs incidental in processing of said application or petition    9112007 petition application procedures applications may be filed by the owners of record of property abutting or bounding the rightofway or easement sought to be vacated all requests for vacation termination abandonment and permanent closure of rightsofway or easements shall be made in petition form upon an application furnished by the lead review department which shall be signed by all owners of property abutting the portion of the rightofway or easement sought to be vacated and shall require the following information 1 the name and address of the petitioners 2 evidence of the petitioners ownership or interest in the petition site 3 a general description of the rightofway or easement that petitioners seek to have abandoned vacated terminated or permanently closed and the location of same 4 type of petition the petition shall identify the type of petition as being for abandonment of a a city rightofway b a public easement c the publics interest in a private rightofway 5 justification petitioners relevant reasons in support of the request to abandon and vacate the rightofway or easement 6 a survey of any existing structures buildings fences or other encroachments contained on the petition site which are related to the reason that the request is being made where applicable 7 the petition shall be signed by the legal property owners of all lands abutting the petition site that agree or consent to the vacation    9112007 review procedure a each application shall be reviewed for sufficiency by the lead review department b following a determination that the application is complete the lead review department shall distribute the application accompanied by maps survey drawings and any other pertinent information to the reviewing departments utilities and applicable agencies c upon receipt of the petition each reviewing department shall submit a written response containing its finding and recommendations to the lead review department upon receipt of all written findings and utility input the lead review department shall review the application and reports and shall notify the petitioners in writing of any conditions to be performed prior to making a recommendation to the city manager for action by the city council d within 60 days of receipt of the lead review departments notification the petitioners shall either comply with agree and commit in writing to the conditions or disagree in writing to the conditions failure to respond to the lead review departments notification may result in a recommendation to deny the petition by the lead review department e after expiration of the 60day period of this section or sooner if conditions are not imposed or if imposed are responded to by the petitioner in the manner set forth in this section the lead review department shall forward the petition together with its findings and recommendations of same in the form of a report to the city manager for subsequent action by the city council    9112007 review criteria following a determination that the application is sufficient for consideration the lead review department shall make a recommendation that addresses the following factors if applicable 1 applications for vacation of rightsofway or easements shall be reviewed to determine whether there is any future likelihood that the rightofway or easement may be needed by the city county state or utility 2 such application shall be analyzed to ensure that the convenient access of property owners on adjoining street rightsofway will not be adversely affected 3 no rightofway or public easement giving access to any publicly accessible waters in the city shall be closed vacated or abandoned except in those instances wherein the petitioners offer to trade or give to the city comparable land for a rightofway or public easement that provide access to the same body of water such access shall not create a hardship on the users a determination on this as well as the distance and comparable land being offered shall be left to the discretion of the city council 4 the lead review department shall obtain written approval or consent of affected utilities to the abandonment of a rightofway or easement 5 if existing utilities or improvements are located in the petition site any provisions for the utilities or improvements to be relocated shall be defined in writing by the affected utility 6 written consent of the utility if a new utility easement will be created within or over the original petition site for existing or planned utility equipment located in the rightofway that is being considered for vacation 7 a determination whether any geographic areas within 2500 feet may be impacted by the proposed action and the nature and degree of impact 8 a determination of what other additional property easements utility relocations agreements or other actions may also be required to accommodate the proposed action the petitioners may be required to provide an alternative rightofway or easement 9 identification and evaluation of the nature and degree of any impacts that the proposed action might have on the delivery and provision of service by public service vehicles 10 identification and evaluation of any impacts the proposed action might have on the surrounding public street system 11 the results of any applicable traffic study 12 a complete list of all owners of abutting and affected property within 500 feet 13 location map a drawing measuring not larger than 85 inches by 14 inches which clearly and legibly identifies the location of the petition site in relation to the nearest public rightofway excluding the petition site and all affected properties the location map may be located on the survey in a separate block 14 abutting property and affected property the petition shall include a map that identifies the boundaries of abutting properties 15 survey a certified land survey measuring not larger than 85 inches by 14 inches shall be prepared by a state registered land surveyor in accordance with the minimum technical standards of fs   and fac ch 21hh6 and attached as an exhibit to the petition the survey shall also contain or depict the following information a an accurate drawing of the petition site b the boundaries of abutting properties    9112007 public hearing  notice a before narrowing or vacating any street alley public highway or portion thereof the city council shall first hold a public hearing at least ten days prior to first reading of the ordinance the city shall mail a notice to all property owners within 500 feet of the portion of the street affected by the proposed vacating or narrowing the giving of said notice being a courtesy notice the notice shall be mailed to each property owner at his last known address as listed on the county property appraisers most current tax roll as displayed in the internet at the time of submission of the petition or from such other source as the lead review department deems reliable the lead review department shall provide proof of such mailing by affidavit filed with the lead review department provided that failure to mail the notice or the mailing of the notice to an erroneous address or wrong property owner shall not invalidate any proceedings hereunder notice of the time and place of such public hearing shall also be given by publication once in a newspaper of general circulation in the city at least ten days prior to the date of the public hearing the notice shall describe the street alley or public highway to be narrowed or vacated and such service by publication shall be verified by the affidavit of the publisher and filed with the city clerk in the event an easement is requested to be narrowed or vacated the abutting property owners shall be notified and the procedures for publication as hereinabove stated for vacating public streets and alleys shall be followed b no rightofway or easement or the public rights therein shall be determined to be vacated terminated abandoned or permanently closed by the city council until the city council has applied the review criteria in section 5299 and it has been determined that 1 the rightofway or easement or rights of the public therein to the extent requested to be vacated terminated abandoned or permanently closed is no longer needed 2 the public health safety welfare aesthetics and economic order of the community will not be compromised by the vacation termination abandonment or permanent closure of the rightofway or easement or rights of the public therein to the extent requested to be vacated terminated abandoned or permanently closed 3 the rights or anticipated and likely future needs of utilities including but not limited to electric gas water wastewater telephone and cable television to use the rightofway or easement will not be compromised or acceptable and adequate alternatives have been provided 4 all properties abutting and utilizing the portion of the rightofway or easement to be vacated abandoned terminated or permanently closed will have adequate alternative rightofway or easement available to serve said abutting properties c when determined by the city council a vacation termination abandonment or permanent closure may be approved conditioned upon certain conditions precedent occurring    9112007 city council action evidenced by ordinance after the public hearing has been held pursuant to section 52100 the city council may by ordinance provide for the vacation termination abandonment and permanent closure of all rights of the public in the rightofway or easement any action of the city council shall be evidenced by an ordinance duly adopted and entered upon the minutes of the city council    9112007 recordation  effective date of vacation the ordinance shall be recorded in the public records of the county the vacation termination abandonment and permanent closure of all rights of the public in the rightofway or easement described in the ordinance shall not become effective until the ordinance has been recorded    9112007 secs 5210352132  reserved article v  newsracks intent  official charged with administrative responsibility  exemptions a the purpose of this article is to promote the public health safety welfare economic order and aesthetics regulations of the placement appearance servicing and ensuring of newsracks on public rightsofway so as to 1 make the downtown redevelopment area an active and attractive pedestrian environment  2 provide the opportunity for creative colorful pedestrianfocused commercial activities  3 promote land conservation and redevelopment  4 provide for pedestrian and driving safety and convenience  5 restrict the unreasonable interference with the flow of pedestrian or vehicular traffic including ingress into or egress from any residence or place of business or from the street to the sidewalk by persons exiting or entering parked or standing vehicles  6 provide reasonable access for the use and maintenance of poles posts traffic signs or signals hydrants mailboxes and access to locations used for public transportation purposes  7 provide for proper access to sidewalks  8 encourage well designed and aesthetically compatible newsracks  9 reduce unnecessary exposure of the city to personal injury or property damage claims  10 provide for and maintain the freedom of speech for newspapers news or other periodicals or advertising circulars using newsracks for distribution purposes  11 improve the economic order of the community  and 12 ensure safe orderly sidewalks that are not blocked by the disorderly or cluttered placement of newsracks for use by wheelchairbound citizens b the building official shall administer the provisions of this article and of newsracks that constitute abandoned property or lost property pursuant to fs ch 705 officers subject to the supervision of the building official are authorized subject to supervision by the building official to enforce this article and enforce the provisions of fs ch 705 with regard to newsracks that constitute abandoned property or lost property as defined in said statute c the following newsracks shall be exempt from regulation pursuant to this article 1 newsracks located wholly on private nongovernmental property  and 2 newsracks located outside the downtown redevelopment area    7121994 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning abandoned property means all tangible personal property which does not have an identifiable owner and which has been disposed of on public property in a wrecked inoperative or partially dismantled condition or which has no apparent intrinsic value to the rightful owner advertising circular means any publication that contains only advertising and no news reports bike path means that portion of a rightofway improved designed or ordinarily used by bicycle traffic for the purposes of this article no sidewalk shall be construed to be a bike path building official means the city building official or said officials designee distributor means the person responsible for placing and maintaining a newsrack the owner or other person having a possessory or other ownership interest in the newsrack or the publisher of the newspaper or other periodical or advertising circular vended from a newsrack regulated by this article downtown redevelopment area means that area of the city as defined by section 2040 as may be amended from time to time downtown redevelopment plan means that plan as specified in section 2064 as may be amended from time to time lost property means all tangible personal property which does not have an identifiable owner and which has been mislaid on public property in a substantially operable functioning condition or which has an apparent intrinsic value to the rightful owner newsrack means any selfservice or coinoperated box container storage unit or other dispenser installed used or maintained for the display sale or distribution of newspapers other periodicals or advertising circulars public agency means the city county or the state rightofway means all that area dedicated to public use or otherwise owned by a public agency for public street purposes and shall include but is not limited to roadways swales bike paths and sidewalks roadway means that portion of a rightofway improved designed or ordinarily used for vehicular traffic sidewalk means any surface within a rightofway provided for the primary use of pedestrians swale means any area within a rightofway which is a drainage pathway curb and gutter of a sidewalk or is used for water retention or detention    7121994 newsracks on public rightsofwaystandards for maintenance and installation a any newsrack which in whole or in part is attached to or rests upon any public rightofway shall comply with the standards set forth in this section b each coinoperated newsrack except where the newspaper or periodical is distributed free shall be equipped with a coinreturn mechanism to permit a person using the machine to secure an immediate refund in the event he is unable to open the newsrack the coinreturn mechanisms shall be maintained by the distributor in good working order c the distributor is charged with the duty of ensuring that each newsrack shall have affixed to it in a readily visible place so as to be seen by anyone using the newsrack the telephone number of a working telephone service to call to report a malfunction or to secure a refund in the event of a malfunction of the coinreturn mechanism and shall feature clearly on its face the name and address of the distributor to give the notices provided for in this article d each newsrack shall be maintained by the distributor in a neat and clean condition and in good repair at all times at the sole cost of the distributor e each newsrack shall be maintained by the distributor in accordance with the terms of this article f the distributor shall be responsible for any damage or repairs caused by the removal or installation of their newsracks    7121994 samelocation and placement of newsracks a any newsrack which is attached to or rests in whole or in part upon or on any portion of a rightofway or which projects onto into or over any part of a rightofway shall be located in accordance with the standards set forth in this section b no newsrack shall be used or maintained which projects onto into or over any part of any roadway or bike path or which rests wholly or in part upon or over any portion of any roadway or bike bath c no newsrack shall be located upon in or over any swale or sidewalk when such 1 installation use or maintenance poses an imminent threat to the safety of persons or property  2 newsrack obstructs the flow of pedestrian or vehicular traffic  or 3 the newsrack placement or location violates state law d no newsrack shall be located 1 within two feet of any kiosk bench trash receptacle drinking fountain bicycle rack mailbox post pole or any area planted with grass shrubs flowers or trees  2 within the triangular shaped real property at the intersection of two public rightsofway described as running away from the intersection and along the edge of the rightofway lines with a line joining points on those lines said points being 25 feet from the intersection  3 within the triangular shaped real property at the intersection of a public rightofway and a private driveway described as running away from the aforesaid intersection and along the edge of the rightofway line and the driveway with a line joining points on those lines said points being 25 feet from said intersection  4 so as to reduce the clear continuous sidewalk width to less than four feet in the c3 zoning district of the downtown redevelopment area  5 within five feet of any fire hydrant  6 within five feet of any driveway or alley  7 within five feet ahead of and 20 feet to the rear of any sign marking a designated bus stop  8 within four feet of a display window or building entrance  9 within two feet of the curb face  or 10 in such manner that pedestrian traffic at any time would be substantially blocked disrupted or slowed e newsracks shall be placed together in groupings consisting of one to six individual newsrack dispenser boxes each grouping of newsracks shall be separated by a distance of not less than ten feet notwithstanding the foregoing in the event there is parallel parking or headin parking provided along a roadway then no newsracks shall be placed so as to block interfere or impair operators of vehicles from exiting their vehicles onto or the sidewalks curbs or rightsofway adjoining said roadways each newsrack within a group shall be separated by no more than two feet from the nearest newsrack f no newsrack may be chained bolted or otherwise attached to any fixture located in the rightofway    7121994 newsracks constituting abandoned or lost property  when newsrack does not have an identifiable owner a when a newsrack does not have an identifiable owner and constitutes abandoned property disposition of said newsrack shall be pursuant to the provisions of fs   relating to abandoned property as therein defined b when a newsrack does not have an identifiable owner and constitutes lost property disposition of said newsrack shall be pursuant to lost property as therein defined    7121994 orders to correct chapter violations  stay upon appeal  when newsrack has an identifiable owner a notice 1 if the building official is able to ascertain the ownerdistributor of a newsrack upon determination by the building official that a newsrack has been installed used or maintained in violation of the provisions of this article  that the newsrack does not have a proper decal as provided in section 52135 to identify the distributor  or that the decal does not properly identify the distributor of the newsrack an order to correct the offending condition may be issued by the building official to the distributor of the newsrack said order shall be mailed postage prepaid by us certified mail return receipt requested to the distributor the order shall describe the offending condition and suggest action necessary to correct the condition the order shall reference any pedestrian and vehicular traffic study containing data that may have been utilized to ascertain the offending condition the order shall also describe the manner in which a distributor may appeal the order pursuant to subsection c of this section 2 additionally the building official shall cause a notice which cannot be easily removed to be posted for at least 20 days on the newsrack determined to be installed used or maintained in violation of this article such notice shall not be less than eight inches by ten inches and shall be sufficiently weatherproofed to withstand normal exposure to the elements 3 the building official shall keep a record noting the date of posting of the notice on the newsrack and the date of mailing of the order to the distributor of the newsrack determined to be in violation of this article b if the offending newsrack is not removed from the public rightofway or the newsrack is not brought into compliance with the provisions of this article within 20 days after receipt of the mailed notice or the posting date of the order whichever event is later in time said newsrack shall be declared by the building official to be lost property pursuant to fs ch 705 a notice of intent to remove the property shall thereupon be posted on the newsrack pursuant to fs  2 the newsrack may later be taken into custody by the city pursuant to fs  2b c the distributor may appeal an order or declaration issued pursuant to subsections a or b of this section such appeal must be made prior to title to the newsrack vesting in the city pursuant to fs   an appeal is initiated by filing with the building official a formal letter advising that the distributor wishes to appeal the order the letter shall constitute a notice of appeal in the event the distributor of the newsrack files an appeal then the determination that the newsrack is lost property or the order to correct the offending condition shall be stayed pending final disposition of the appeal which final disposition shall include all judicial review d appeals upon receipt of a notice of appeal the building official shall provide such notice to the board of adjustment a de novo hearing shall be held with regard to the appeal within a reasonable period of time after receipt of the notice of appeal the appellant shall be given at least five days notice of the time date and place of the hearing the board shall give the appellant and any other interested party a reasonable opportunity to be heard at the conclusion of the hearing the board shall make a final determination the determination shall be reduced to writing signed by the chair and filed in the office of the building official the building official shall record on the order the date upon which the order was similar definitions fs  15 16 tax exemption established a there is herein established an economic development ad valorem tax exemption herein the exemption the exemption is a local option tax incentive for new or expanding businesses which may be granted or refused at the discretion of the city b the exemptions shall not accrue to improvements to real property made by or for the use of new or expanding businesses when such improvements have been included on the tax rolls prior to  the initial effective date of the ordinance from which this article is derived specifically granting a business an exemption as provided in this article c any exemption granted may apply up to 100 percent of the assessed value of all improvements to real property made by or for the use of a new business and of all tangible personal property of such new business or up to 100 percent of the assessed value of all added improvements to real property made to facilitate the expansion of an existing business and of the net increase in all tangible personal property acquired to facilitate such expansion of an existing business  provided that the improvements to real property are made or the tangible personal property is added or increased on or after  the initial effective date of the ordinance from which this article is derived specifically granting a business an exemption as provided in this article property acquired to replace existing property shall not be considered to facilitate a business expansion d the exemption shall be granted by ordinance for every eligible project as determined by the city council at its discretion the exemption will become effective on the date of adoption of the ordinance and may be granted for a period up to ten years commencing with the first year the new real property improvements or personal property are added to the assessment roll e no exemption shall be granted for the land upon which new or expanded businesses are to be located f the exemption shall apply only to taxes levied by the city the exemption shall not apply to taxes levied by the county school district or water management district or to taxes levied for the payment of bonds or taxes authorized by a vote of the electors pursuant to section 9 and section 12 article vii of the state constitution g the ability to receive an exemption for the period granted period the applicant shall be required to submit a report on an annual basis to the city evidencing satisfaction of this condition in addition any business granted an exemption shall furnish to the authorities fs   article i  in general traffic engineering a the city manager or city managers designee shall exercise the powers and duties provided in this article and as otherwise specifically provided in this chapter b it is the general duty of the city manager or city managers designee to plan and determine the installation and proper timing and maintenance of official traffic control devices  to plan and direct the operation of traffic on the streets parking areas and parking garages  to conduct investigations of traffic conditions  to cooperate with other municipal county and state officials and to make recommendations for the improvement of traffic movement and conditions including improvements in streets parking areas and parking garages  and to carry out the additional powers and duties imposed by this chapter or as directed by the city council c the city manager or managers designee is hereby delegated with the authority to regulate the times days and places of parking stopping and standing on any rightofway subject to the control of the city in any municipally owned or operated surface parking lot on any street or highway or in any municipal parking garage  designated parking spaces  speed limits consistent with state law  the location of oneway streets  whether to install traffic calming devices  traffic flow  and hazardous conditions in making a determination that a regulation is needed or that an official sign or official traffic control device should be installed erected or removed at a given location the city manager or said managers designee may coordinate with the city engineer and seek a recommendation from the city engineer upon such approval by the city manager or said managers designee the city engineer shall conspicuously post official signs or erect official traffic control devices advising the public and motor vehicle operators of any parking or motor vehicle operation regulations or designating and regulating the use of parking spaces or implementing the regulation or determination made by the city manager or said managers designee relating to traffic flow or hazardous conditions oneway streets and speed limits      10222002   292010 speed limits the purpose of this section is to officially adopt speed limits within the city to establish uniformity and consistency and enhance public safety 1 the speed limit on all streets within the city except where otherwise designated by official traffic control devices shall be 30 miles per hour however with respect to a residential area the traffic engineer may set a maximum speed limit of 25 miles per hour on local streets after an investigation determines that such a speed limit is reasonable 2 the speed limit designated school zone or crossing within the city shall be 15 miles per hour except where otherwise designated by official traffic control devices such speed limit shall be in force only during those times 30 minutes before during and 30 minutes after the periods of time when pupils are arriving at a regularly scheduled breakfast program or a regularly scheduled school session and leaving a regularly scheduled school session 3 the speed limit on any newly platted minor local residential street as defined in appendix d chapter 8 subdivision code within the city shall be 25 miles per hour except where otherwise designated by official traffic control devices unless a request is received and approved by the city manager or said managers designee to raise the speed limit      10222002   6262007   292010 state law reference authority regarding speed limits fs    oneway streets whenever in the judgment of the city manager or said managers designee any street is designated as a oneway street roadway or alley the city engineer shall place and maintain official signs giving notice thereof and no such regulation shall be effective unless such signs are in place signs indicating the direction of lawful traffic movement shall be placed at every intersection where movement of traffic in the opposite direction is prohibited such oneway streets shall be so designated by order of the city manager or said managers designee with the approval of the city manager and shall be based upon traffic engineering studies      10222002   292010 state law reference oneway streets fs    operation of trucks  restrictions a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning designated street means those arterial and collector roadways as designated by the city comprehensive plan transportation element as amended from time to time over and along which trucks shall operate deviating truck means a truck that leaves and departs from a designated street while traveling inside the city truck means any selfpropelled or towed vehicle used on the public highways in commerce to transport passengers or cargo if such vehicle 1 has a gross vehicle weight rating of 10000 pounds or more  2 is designed to transport more than 15 passengers including the driver  or 3 is used in the transportation of materials found to be hazardous for the purposes of the hazardous materials transportation act as amended from time to time 49 usc 1801 et seq b observance required  exceptions 1 generally all trucks within the city shall be operated only over and along designated streets except as otherwise provided in this article 2 exemptions this article shall not prohibit a operation on street of destination the operation of trucks upon any street where necessary to conduct business at a destination point if streets on which truck traffic is permitted are used until reaching the intersection nearest the destination point upon leaving the destination point the deviating truck shall return to the designated street by the shortest permissible route b authorized emergency vehicles the operation of emergency vehicles upon any street in the city c public utilities the operation of trucks owned andor operated by the city public utilities any contractor or material supplier while engaged in the repair maintenance or construction of streets or street utilities within the city d detoured trucks the operation of a truck upon any officially established detour route      10222002 state law reference authority regarding truck routes fs   offtheroad vehicles a offtheroad vehicles defined as used in this section the term offtheroad vehicle shall mean any motorpropelled vehicle including all terrain vehicles fourwheel drive vehicles jeeps dune buggies motorcycles minibikes and every other description of motorpropelled vehicles used or capable of being used as a means of transportation over land areas not graded or paved for use as a road b permission required for use in certain areas prior to operating an offtheroad vehicle in an area not graded or paved for use as a road the operator of the vehicle must be in possession of written permission from the owner of the land where the vehicle is being operated further if the offtheroad vehicle is being operated within 500 feet of a residence the operator of the offtheroad vehicle must have permission from the occupant of the residence      10222002 traffic calming measures the city engineer is authorized to prepare administrative procedures and criteria to evaluate a street using commonly accepted engineering standards and may propose to liability for parking violation a under authority of fs ch 316 as amended from time to time the owner of a vehicle is responsible and liable for payment of any parking violation under this article unless the owner can furnish evidence that the vehicle was at the time of the parking violation stolen or in the care custody or control of another person or under lease in such instances the owner of the vehicle is required within a reasonable time after notification of the parking violation to furnish to the appropriate law enforcement authorities an affidavit setting forth the name and address and drivers license number of the person who leased rented or otherwise had the care custody or control of the vehicle the affidavit submitted is admissible in a proceeding charging a parking ticket violation and raises the rebuttable presumption that the person identified in the affidavit is responsible for payment of the parking ticket violation the owner of a vehicle shall not be held responsible for parking violations for a vehicle if the vehicle involved was at the time stolen or in the care custody or control of some person who did not have permission of the owner to use the vehicle the owner of a leased vehicle is not responsible for a parking ticket violation and is not required to submit an affidavit or the other evidence specified in this section if the vehicle is registered in the name of the person who leased the vehicle b prima facie evidence that the vehicle involved was at the time stolen or under lease or in the care custody or control of some person who did not have permission of the owner to use the vehicle shall be in the form of a report from the appropriate law enforcement official that the said vehicle was stolen or under lease or not under the definition of costs      7242001   10242006 general rules a applicability the general rules for the extension of water and sewer mains as hereinafter set forth shall apply to all extensions of the municipal water andor wastewater collection and disposal systems within and without the city and without respect to whether the extension is for the benefit of an individual consumer or a new subdivision development b application application for the extension of water andor wastewater disposal service shall be made in writing on a standard form provided by the city the executed form shall constitute a binding agreement setting forth the terms and conditions under which the service shall be extended c economic feasibility except as later modified herein all proposed water and sewer main extensions will be analyzed from the standpoint of sound business practices and all such extensions must conform to the citys economic feasibility test in order not to impose a burden upon existing customers which would necessitate future rate increases an extension will be considered economically feasible if the revenue produced by the connection or connections to the proposed extension based on anticipated average daily water consumption and where applicable wastewater flows as established by the citys engineer will equal or exceed the cost of operation and maintenance of the system plus 150 percent of the principal and interest cost of the extension project based on a 30year period of time at the thenusual interest rate an additional 25 percent of the total cost as established above shall be added to the computed cost to determine the cost of providing service to areas beyond the corporate limits of the city d customer participation where anticipated revenue from the sale of water and wastewater disposal service is insufficient to economically warrant a main extension by the city main extensions may be considered provided the applicant contributes construction funds in an amount sufficient to make the extension economically feasible under the citys feasibility test e location and installation water and sewer mains will be extended and located only in public rightsofway or in easements acceptable to the city in new subdivisions water and wastewater facilities may be installed only in streets alleys or other rightsofway where the finished grade has been established and approved by the appropriate governmental agency further the extension may not be installed until the street alley or other rightsofway have been constructed to at least finished subgrade 1 inspection and testing of water distribution and wastewater collection system extensions for acceptance shall not be made until the grading storm sewers and street improvements are substantially completed the final inspection for acceptance will be made only from certified asbuilt drawings four sets of which shall be furnished to the city upon completion of the installation 2 a construction permit issued by the city will be required prior to starting work at that time the applicant desiring a permit must show evidence that he has the approved plans from which to construct the work  and also at which time the inspection cost to the applicant as established in section 5868 and all other applicant contributions for the cost of construction as set forth in this subsection e shall be paid 3 a 48hour notice of intent to start work shall be given to the city water and sewer department at which time all required construction materials exclusive of brass fittings shall be on the job site for inspection f construction standards all materials construction procedures and installation shall be in strict accordance with the applicable sections of the latest revised edition of the technical provisions for construction of water distribution systems technical provisions for construction of sanitary sewer systems technical provisions for construction of sanitary sewer lift stations and technical provisions for construction of reclaimed water distribution systems on file with the citys engineer and subject to the approval and inspection of the citys engineer at all times any material equipment or installation which may be required and is not covered by the citys specifications shall be approved by the citys engineer prior to the start of construction g ownership the ownership of any extension and appurtenances laid in accordance with any application shall at all times remain in the city and an agreement shall be executed to this effect prior to the start of construction h citys rights reserved no agreement to extend the citys water or wastewater disposal systems under the provisions of this article shall restrict the citys right to make further extensions nor incur any additional obligation to any original participant should the city subsequently extend any original extension      7242001   10242006 extension of service for individual interpretation and application of this article and division relating to rates fees and charges shall be first presented to the city engineer in interpreting and applying this the city engineer shall be first guided by the plain meaning of the words and terms in this second by the intent expressed herein the city engineer shall make interpretations and applications by interpreting the a whole and not by taking specific words or clauses in isolation any application and interpretation shall be subject to rendition in a written dated form thereafter the planning and zoning board shall decide appeals from the city engineers application and interpretation where it is alleged that there is error in any order requirement decision or determination made by the city engineer in interpreting or applying this b decisions that may be appealed 1 appeals to the planning and zoning board may be taken by the city or any person aggrieved by any decision of the following a interpretation by the city engineer of the meaning of wording in this division made pursuant to subsection a of this section  b a determination by the city engineer as to the amount of fee deposit deposit refund impact fee charge or rate payable the meter size or other category utilized for calculation of the fee deposit or charge amount or assessment  c a determination by the city engineer as to any calculations made exemptions or credits awarded  or d a determination by the city manager as to any adjustments made to water bills based on excessive water consumption as provided in section 58137 2 a person aggrieved error or improper determination in interpreting or application of this division relating to rates charges fees and deposits c method of appeal appeals to the planning and zoning board shall be made within a reasonable time not to exceed 30 days following the date of rendition of the interpretation or other determination as set forth in subsection b of this section by filing with the official making the determination and with the secretary to the planning and zoning board a notice of appeal specifying the ground thereof the official making the determination shall within 15 days thereafter transmit to the planning and zoning board all papers constituting the record upon which the action appealed from was taken the secretary to the planning and zoning board after receipt of the record shall fix a time for hearing of the appeal and give the public notice thereof at least 15 days in advance of the public hearing as well as notice to the parties in interest and decide the same within variance from the specific landscape irrigation days set forth in section 58162 may be granted if strict application of the scheduled days would lead to unreasonable or unfair results in particular instances provided that the applicant demonstrates with particularity that compliance with the scheduled days will result in a substantial economic health or other hardship on the applicant requesting other zones of the property however in no event shall a variance allow a single zone to be irrigated more than two days per week during daylight savings time or more than one day per week during eastern standard time    4142009 declaration of water shortage emergency a water shortage emergency is hereby declared to exist when one or more of the following criteria is met 1 the st johns river water management district declares a water shortage or water shortage emergency applicable to the county or the upper st johns basin 2 the st johns river water management district the us government or the state mandates for any reason that the city water system take steps to reduce the consumption of water 3 the level of water in lake washington falls to an elevation of 11 feet mean sea level or lower 4 the city council declares for any reason that a water shortage emergency exists      4142009 implementation of restriction or curtailment of water uses in a declared water shortage a the curtailments and restrictions of water uses provided for herein shall be implemented upon the declaration of a water shortage emergency and shall remain in effect until such time as such emergency shall continue b nonessential uses of water shall be restricted or curtailed during the existence of a water shortage emergency these restrictions shall include but are not limited to the following 1 the sprinkling watering or irrigating of shrubbery trees lawns grass ground covers plants vines and gardens shall be limited to the hours of  am to  am andor  pm to  pm as provided in the schedule given in section 58162 unless by discharge from heat pump air conditioning units 2 the escape of water plumbing or knowingly allowing water to escape water system 3 the washing of sidewalks driveways porchexteriors of homes apartments or other outdoor surfaces 4 the washing of business or industrial equipment and machinery except as required for the public health 5 the operation of any ornamental fountain or other structure using water with or without a recirculating system 6 the filling of swimming pools and wading pools not using a filter and recirculating system 7 the washing of automobiles trucks trailers railroad cars mobile homes campers or any other type of mobile equipment except at a business enterprise established for such purpose which recycles at least 75 percent of water used 8 the use of water for dust control except as required for the public health 9 the use of water for hydrant flushing except for the purpose of maintaining chlorine residuals c the city manager shall have the authority to permit a reasonable use of water in any case necessary to maintain adequate health and sanitation standards the city manager shall also be authorized to permit the use of water by commercial enterprises in excess of the requirements of this division upon finding that such use is necessary to continue business operations and is in the public interest these permits shall be issued within the sound discretion of the manager and shall be issued only upon the showing of good cause for the uses requested      7102007   4142009 enforcement a every city police officer or city daily discharges over a calendar month calculated as the sum of all daily discharges measured during a calendar month divided by the number of daily discharges measured during that month new source 1 facility or installation is constructed at a site at which no other source is located  b the building structure facility or installation totally replaces the process or production equipment that existing source at the same site in determining whether these are substantially independent factors such as the extent to which the new facility is integrated with the existing plant and the extent to
